The mendicants’ request to the Buddha [s: Several mendicants who were heading for the west went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him, “Sir, we wish to go to a western land to take up residence there.”
The Buddha’s response to the mendicants: The Buddha asked if they had consulted with Sāriputta
The mendicants replied that they hadn't
The Buddha advised them to consult with Sāriputta
Sāriputta’s advice to the mendicants (a: Sāriputta advised the mendicants to properly hear, learn, attend, and remember the teachings, and penetrate them with wisdom
Sāriputta instructed the mendicants on how to answer questions from astute people who inquire about the Buddha’s teachings
Sāriputta explained the drawback and benefit of removing desire and lust for form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness
Sāriputta explained why the Buddha praises giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities
The mendicants’ response to Sāriputta (a: The mendicants were satisfied and happy with what Sāriputta said.
